results.definition: a highly developed state of perfection; having a flawless or impeccable quality
examples: I admired the exquisite refinement of his prose
almost an inspiration which gives to all work that finish which is almost art"--Joseph Conrad
he described a refinement of this technique

results.definition: the process of removing impurities (as from oil or metals or sugar etc.)
a subtle difference in meaning or opinion or attitude
examples: without understanding the finer nuances you can't enjoy the humor
don't argue about shades of meaning

results.definition: the quality of excellence in thought and manners and taste
examples: he is remembered for his generosity and civilization
